reviews.review_text: Haven t been here for a while but it did not disappoint. The prices have gone up and the portions gone down but it was still as yummy as ever. Would recommend coming for a quick and delicious bite!! The spring rolls are AMAZING. Weirdly enough, we both felt kind of high after eating here, maybe cus of the neon lights?

Down to earth restaurant serving good portions of pho. You can choose between Small, Medium and Large all at reasonable prices. Their beef broth is one of the best I have tasted in a while and would recommend at least a try to decide for yourself.

Really yummy pho, I don t find their portion sizes too small. The ratio of noodle and toppings were decent, it was a good size for me, although I will admit that it s less noodles in comparison to other pho places. The stuffed chicken wings were very interesting, although I wouldn t get it again. I would revisit for their beef pho.

We come here in the evenings when we want pho. Its usually not busy at thia timw so there is no wait. Street parking is easily available nearby. The food is served lightning quick. The pho broth is slightly sweet. Overall if you want a quick, reasonably priced meal, that is tasty, this place has you covered.
Sooo yum! The crispy roll is super crispy! I d say this restaurant has the best crispy roll in the town! Thanks for the great food and friendly service :)

Best sate pho #21 with either lemongrass (normal) or coconut soup base. Best stew #27 perfectly balanced beefy stock with carrot and sweet fried onion soup base and brisket.  I ve been coming here regularly for a few years now, their food quality and service is super consistent and quick!

This is the place to go if you want some Vietnamese home-style food without too much wait. This is a family business and they have quick turnover, quite different and refreshing given there are so many chains and more formal dining nearby. The location is perfect as it s close to shopping centers, perfect for a quick lunch or dinner.

One would definitely not expect a restaurant with express in its name to be so darn good. Im from the US east coast so even with the numerous Viet places there, I can for sure say this was the best Viet Ive had for as long as I can remember. Ordered a delicious pho with satay coconut soup, regular pho to test their basics, and also a really good grilled pork and spring roll in vermicelli. I wish I could go back for more but its mostly a half world away now for me.

The first time I was here was 2020 during the covid lockdown. My roommate and I got takeout, and I dont even remember exactly what I ordered but I remember liking it. I was nearby recently and needed dinner so I thought Id try visiting them again, this time to dine in. I got the veggies and tofu curry on rice. Very good comfort food, flavourful but not overwhelmingly hot, and not oily, making it easy on the palate and the stomach. The portion size was perfect, with a good serving of tofu and lots of vegetables both in the curry and in the salad. I also had the  3 kinds of bean w/ coconut milk and ice . It s under the  drinks  section of the menu but theirs was more of a frozen dessert than a drink since the ice was a little coarse to drink through a straw. It was tasty though, with lots of the toppings. The beans were very filling. They were fairly busy but the food came out pretty quickly. The service here was a step above the hands-off service style that s typical of pho joints. The waitress checked in on me after I got my food to make sure everything was okay, and the whole staff team was really sweet. I think the decoration in the restaurant is fun, it s a little eclectic but not  loud . I would recommend this place over most other  express  Vietnamese restaurants for the experience all-around.

Sitting in hotel watching  Olympic downhill skiing, got bored at 2030 and decided to go out for a snack. Saw this divey Vietnamese place, it was calling out my name Pink and red walls with various southeast Asia posters, 1 star TV showing Olympics, 1 star Quite a few customers considering it was after 2030, 1 star Efficient friendly owner and staff speaking Vietnamese, 1 star Spring rolls were the largest Ive ever had, rice noodle ratio to shrimp was a bit too much Beef stew noodle was vey flavorful, not sure if it was the MSG but Ill know later on. Good value for money. Late night munchies satisfied
Would totally recommend for a quick and delicious bite. The prices have gone up and portions are smaller but its still really good quality!
Awesome food. Big portion. Sweet service. Will def come again and again. Recommend the pork and egg rice place.
Gets the job done and then some. Solid downtown entry for noodle soup. Reliable and consistent. Food : 5/5
This Vietnamese restaurant is just awesome... Fantastic food... Excellent service... Its also easily accessible in downtown Vancouver... I highly recommend...

One of my fiance and I favorite place to eat downtown. The lemongrass chicken is my favorite along with the spring roll to start. Ive eaten here about 10 times over the last year and will continue to stop in if the quality and consistency stays the part!
So delicious. First time having pho. Got the lemongrass rare steak pho and spring rolls! Really filling without making you feel sick and tired. Will be returning
I wish i could give the service a 6 star. They were fantastic, everything way better than my expectations. Wonderful, will definitely go again (probably tomorrow  )
We ve been coming to this restaurant for years. The food taste good, fresh, good portion, the service is always very good, reliable, quick and the price is very reasonable.

Walked pass this restaurant hundreds of times and thought  I should try this place out sometime  never to give it a second thought tip the next time. Today the girlfriend suggested it after not knowing what to have for lunch. Holy moly we were not disappointed, quite the opposite. It s outstanding, quick service, clean, polite staff. And the food is excellent, even more so the value of it. Great place to get hot food on a cold day.
Cozy place, well priced. Would go again.
This is our go to pho place, love their fresh rolls and beef skewers as well. The outside patio is the best, we bring our dog and turn him just outside our table and a chain fence. Food : 5/5
Pho is delicious! I also like their spring and salad rolls.
Love the pho here, decent price too and honestly think they give you a nice portion compared to a lot of other places.
I was hungry And I find good restaurants! Try spring roll And generous portion

Yes, yes, and so much yes! Wish this was local!! Outdoor seating was nice, despite the windy day. Pho was amazing, grilled chicken was so freaking delish. Dessert drink was nice too, colorful and sweet Service was great!

This is now our favourite Vietnamese place in downtown Vancouver. We tried it for the first time today after living in the area for years and the broth of their soups and the spring rolls were insanely good - so good, there is only an after photo. Would recommend!
This is my favourite Pho spot when I need a pick me up! Delicious

My gf and I shared the salad roll (shrimp) and a spring roll. They were perfect. They have lots of different Pho options. The pho we had was spicy with a thicker sauce and was 10/10. Service was very quick and friendly. More of a diner feel than a restaurant, but the food was 10/10.
Great pho spot for a quick and cheap meal. Family owned and snappy service. Ive been here many times and the quality is consistent.
Noodles to nourish your soul on a rainy Vancouver afternoon. I had the pho sate which was a spicy and satisfying broth. Friendly staff and cute restaurant!
My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in downtown Vancouver. Good taste and welcoming staff.. Always happy to be there :) Food
Food is excellent, always quick service and very dependable. Pho is great and I also recommend the #64 vermicelli bowl.
Nice pho place. Price is decent especially for downtown. The egg rolls were excellent!
Best Pho I ever had in Van city.

I really liked this place! The food is so good and the flavor is incomparable, personally the best noodles I have tasted from all my trips, the place is also an experience, people from everywhere, and curious decorations. Finally I have to remark the great service, we got our order really quick and the waitress was care about our experience
Great food for the money! It s more of a fast food sit in/takeaway style restaurant than a fancy dine in but it s comfortable and food is great. Big portions:)
Great rice noodles with veggies. Serving bowl size is large compared to regular pho places
I ordered #37 with yellow noodles. Noodles had great chew, and the broth was delicious.  Very satisfying on a rainy day.
Absolutely amazing place for Pho! The food was the best Vietnamese place I have ever been too! The service is very efficient!
I really enjoyed the vegetarian pho satay I had here. Very flavourful and full of variety. Eating outside in their booths during the warmer months is truly wonderful.

My go to  hole in the wall . I came to this, curiosity piqued by all the cops that frequent. I assume they know what s good for dinner because they know donut and coffee shops real good. And they weren t wrong. I have yet to have something not delectable from there!
Great place for a quick tasty lunch or dinner. Quick and polite service. The accept cash or debit cards. Recommended
Extremely good pho. You can really tell that the food is cared for. Bean sprouts and basil are of the highest quality. Broth is incredible. Five stars.
This has been my favourite restaurant for years! The staff is friendly, the service is fast, and they have the best Vietnamese food in Vancouver! 55 is a must try!

Use to come here multiple times a week when I lived in Yaletown. Great local spot, great food, great service. Any time I felt like I need a good hearty noodle soup, I would always end up here. Our favourites are the spring rolls, the satay soup and then house special! One of my favourite Pho restaurants in the city hands down!
Doesnt accept MasterCard. Tea was atrocious. Satay soup was a piece of heaven, Fried Pork Vermicelli too. Vietnamese Coffee a bit too sweat for my taste and lacks bitterness. Calm place, recommended.
Love this restaurant! Very tasty food and great prices. And you get huge portions which is amazing! Recommend!

Went there for the first time today, I ordered Togo to eat lunch with my dad at home. And he had to wait outside since he was using his large scooter. While waiting the staff gave a free tea for him! They were very kind and it s nice that they noticed him outside. We didn t wait too long for the food and it tasted good once we ate it! It was overall a great experience. Would definitely go again.

Extremely sweet and friendly staff! We had their lemongrass grilled pork vermicelli bowl and it was probably the best we ve ever had in town. We literally couldn t stop talking about how amazing the food and staff were! This is definitely our go-to place for delicious Vietnamese cuisine. 5 stars.
Best chicken skewers I have ever had. They are also the nicest people.

A friend of mine recommended this place and it was a very nice place for Vietnamese food. Food was served quick and hot and suuuuper tasty! 10/10 would go back again! Staff is also super friendly, attending and not pushy at all!

Best pho place downtown. The broth is so flavourful that no other place compares. Went here a lot before all the covid shut downs, and i am glad that it is just as good as i remember it 2 years later. Try the Satay here, absolutely mouth watering.

Delicious Vietnamese and well priced! Hubby had vermicelli and I had wonton soup. Both were very good. My soup came with fresh lime, bean sprouts and basil (lots of basil!) on the side. It was perfect for a rainy Vancouver day. Service was wonderful. Very friendly and efficient. And unlike other reviewers we had no issues with our bill.

My partner and I have been weekly regulars (if not more often!) since we found this gem. Incredible friendly service, we are always so well taken care of! And the food, it is soooo delicious! I ve tried many items on the menu and still can t pick a favourite. Everything is just so amazing!
Exceptional Pho! Very pleasant surprise to find this gem
I wanna say the customer services is really good, I am talking about the new male guy, he is so nice, friendly and thoughtful.

A place I always walk past and wanted to try. Tonight I finally did and it didn t disappoint. Absolutely delicious, and the service was so nice. Everyone comments on it for a reason. Bit of a gem tbh. Exactly the food you wanted when you made the decision to come to a place like this. Flavour is turned up to 11! It was so good I forgot to take photos! Try it

The pho was amazing, and the pork rolls were crunchy and really savory.  The shrimp on sugar cane was also totally worth trying.  It was surprisingly quiet when I went, but dont let that fool you from the food and the price!  I made sure I tipped well as one of the staff chased down someone when they realized they hadnt given him his pork rolls in his order.  I thought that was just great service.
Ive been dining at this place for years not only their food taste really good, but also theyre always kind and thats why this is my go to place for Pho

Good food, good prices. I use this place for take out. They are fast and the soups are packaged very well for transport: the noodles and broth are in separate bowls so you can combine them upon receiving the order.
Best Vietnamese in Yaletown. Generous portions, flavourful food, and great service! The outdoor seating is a bonus. Highly recommend their spring rolls - yum!

I have never had a bad meal here, its where I tend to bring guests because its very close. Service super fast. House special peanut satay 20a is unmissable if you enjoy spicy food. Ambiance like a pachinko parlour met a discount painting sale but I really dont care, Im here for the food. In summer the outdoor seating is nice to have, I generally choose that when its warm. You need to go to the till when its time to pay.

Very surprised about this place. Outdoor seating was nice, service was quick and friendly and the food itself. Damn, even at 10pm its fresh. Pho is decent but I recommend checking out the vermicelli and rice bowls.

Very authentic! Love the beef combo pho, and you can request less sweet broth. We always finish the entire bowl, savory broth and delicious rice noodle. The shrimp salad roll is also great, especially the peanut sauce, sweet and savory. Its a family ran business, and they take pride in their food and knows everything about it.
Best pho place in downtown Vancouver. Staff is friendly. Food is prepared quickly and efficiently. Really enjoyed every time that I ve been here!

You might think its your typical Pho place, but this place is special. They have the typical selection youd expect, and do a good job. But, they have a house special Pho broth, satay coconut peanut or the like. It is amazing! And not like anything Ive had at other Vietnamese places in Vancouver, though reminds me of some soups I had in Cambodia. Also, their Bun Bo Hue is great!

Excellent Pho, noodles are right texture, good variety of items to choose from in the menu, good portions and all reasonably priced.  I dont care about the decor, I eat there whenever I am downtown. They dont take credit card, but this allows them to give you the best deal and best value for money spent.

Ive walked by this place everyday for the last few years and never gave it a chance. Im glad I did because everything was actually super delicious! I ordered a few things for take out spring roll, veggie salad roll, curry chicken with fried rice and beef stew with yellow noodle. Portions were huge and was around $40 total (so cheap!) - we have enough for lunch today too! I will come back and try some other items. Thank you!

Best Pho. Best sugar cane prawns, best lemongrass beef vermicelli. Really never ordered anything that wasn t flavourful and nicely cooked. Generous portions and affordable prices. They don t take credit card though so be prepared with cash or debit.
Amazing pho! Highly recommend to anyone. Their portions are pretty big. The spring rolls are delicious. Today I tried their deep fried wontons and i was very impressed

This is my go-to restaurant when Im craving for something savory and soupy. I always order their spicy peanut butter coconut seafood soup and it is consistently good. Whenever my friend asks for a Vietnamese restaurant recommendation in Downtown, I bring them here. Try them out! (p.s. their decor is a little eclectic and distracting but the food is great so its worth a try!)

This is a great family run place. I have never had a bad meal here, but I especially love the coconut satay soup. The spring rolls are really garlicy, which I love. They dont take credit cards, but they do take debit.
My go to place when Im craving pho. I always get the peanut satay soup with coconut milk its so delicious
Ordered spicy beef thick vermicelli - it was fantastic! Service and staff was super friendly. There were many good menu options, it was hard to choose. Lots of vegetarian options too. Great place!
Great food. Although they made a mistake on our take-out order. Still delicious.
Variety is one of their greatest strength ! Such a good place to have quick lunch or a nice long group coming in! Good and fast service ! 100% recommend to swing by here ;)

Amazing mixed beef pho! Their rare steak, brisket, and tendon are fresh and tender. The portion is absolutely HUGE. Their lemon grass chicken was large enough for two meals. Probably one of the best pho places Ive had.
AWESOME noodles. Super friendly staff with quick service and good prices. Very full menu with lots of options including many vegetarian and some vegan friendly dishes.

Amazing Vietnamese restaurant. The prices are very, very reasonable, the food is delicious, the portion was giant. My server was beautiful, polite, and efficient. My extra large pho was ready in about 3 minutes. I will certainly go back.

Just the best downtown for authentic Vietnamese/Cambodian. Bad reviews are from those stuck up people accustomed to snooty overpriced western posh pho places. Wonderful amazing service. Coconut peanut satay pho recommended!

Best noodles in Vancouver! The family owned business has excellent customer service. We re regular costumers because they re very welcoming and the food is great. Highly recommend it over any other pho s i know.
Real chopsticks, napkin dispenser at table, as well as sriracha and hoisin sauce, delicious pho broth, lots of meat. Best Pho place. Only thing they need is Jalapenos. Love this place

The best PHO I have ever had. The broth has so much flavor and is seasoned perfectly. Dont need to add anything to it. Plus their spring rolls are so delicious and are absolutely neccessary to eat every time. Also their grilled pork vermicelli just melts in your mouth. This will be my go to place from now on. Everyone should check it out.
Great viet food for reasonable price
Great atmosphere, service and food
The BEST Vietnamese place downtown in my opinion. Usually get the beef noodle stew and spring rolls but I ve had other things in the menu and haven t hit a bad one yet. Go!!
Best value spot in Vancouver. Great service, quick food delivery, above average taste.

Second best kept secret in Yaletown. The food here is fresh, tasty, authentic and very reasonably priced. It s all the dishes from my childhood and I m ecstatic. I would have kept eating ph  if it were physically possible and the banh mi were so crispy chewy delicious that I m already thinking of my next visit.
Chicken skewers pop off. Big portions, fast and good price! This my go-to for pho.

Food is excellent quality, good price and huge portions. Went the last two days on a row. $30 for two people to be stuffed to the gills is unheard of at a sit down restaurant in Yale town.  I think their decor wasn t so  look at me look at me!  Neon signs every where, it would be more busy. Makes it seem kinda dive-y but it s very clean inside. I think they d also do well if they offered delivery from Lazy Meal, SkiptheDishes or the like. Would hate to see this lil gem shut down for lack of business. Tried the rare beef pho with spicey satay coconut broth ($8.50), pork spring rolls ($6.50) and lemongrass chicken ($8.50). Huge portions. Each meal could feed two people easily. I d recommend that the restaurant cash in on the late night bar crowd from Granville st and stay open until 2am on Fri/Sat
Very friendly staff, delicious food.

It was very busy when I got there and I got fast service and the food came up quite quickly too, tasted very delicious, lots of meat and the broth tastes very good! Slightly on the higher side of average priced but not too expensive. Definitely coming back here again

My order was misheard over the phone for a veggie soup mistaking for veggie sub. So once i came back they quickly fixed my order and bill. Than i had my hot pho with salad roll and was further meeting my expectations made up for all inconveniences.
My fav pho place downtown! Finally gave it a try after walking by almost every day and it was just SO GOOD. Not a chain and you can tell everything is fresh. The spring rolls are a MUST try
Please support this excellent family run restaurant.  Amazing Vietnamese and Cambodian food with large portions and great value.  Hard working family providing consistently friendly and fast service.

My go to Vietnamese place now. Excited to have finally tried it. Everything is affordable and super stacked. The sandwhich es and Bun bo Hue soup are stuffed with good things. And they have unique allies like the stuffed chicken wings. Place looks funny with the flashy signs and terrible paint but it makes it fun lol.
Good food Good price Good service Food : 5/5 | Service
You can get a good quality pho here. Its a decent size place and they also have tables outside too. Parking is a bit tricky, but on Seymour st you can find a spot of your light.
Absolutely the best pho downtown
Cheap cheap cheap cheap cheapest Pho you can get in downtown and plus their not that bad! Service is fast and they are super nice! I always go here! Try the spring roll and salad roll! Its huge!
